result.execSummary:
The defendant Edgar H. Nazer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Condition for Probation on Count 2, 3 and 5:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Shall not possess any part of a firearm.
Successfully complete counseling as recommended.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges on count 5.
Credit in the event of revocation: 4 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Any and all fines, costs, surcharges, and restitution (if any ordered) to be paid directly by the Defendant to the Richland County Clerk of Court. Defendant has 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court. Failure to pay in full within 60 days or failure to stay current on an approved payment plan will result in entry of civil judgment with interest and submission of the debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue State Debt Collection (SDC) Unit.

Defendant to keep the Clerk of Court informed of any change in contact information (address and/or phone number).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Edgar H. Nazer in court.  Attorney David E Saperstein in court for Edgar H. Nazer.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Saperstein provides the court with the plea questionnaire form and notes that they will be entering a plea on count 2, 3, and 5. All other counts will be DRI. The joint recommendation is 2 years probation with condition of not to possess or consume alcohol. not to possess a firearm and counseling a recommended. Court goes over the plea questionnaire. Court finds a factual basis. EN enter a NC plea. Attorney Forehand reads the victims letter. Attorney Saperstein heard. 

Count 2, 3, and 5
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 2 years.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Shall not possess any part of a firearm.
Successfully complete counseling as recommended.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges on count 5.
Credit in the event of revocation: 4 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today

Count 1, 4 and 6 - DRI

10:32 AM Defendant Edgar H. Nazer in court.  Attorney David E Saperstein in court for Edgar H. Nazer.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Saperstein provides the court with the waiver of right to a preliminary hearing. EN states that he has gone  over the from with his attorney. Court goes over the form and binds over to trial. Attorney Forehand is filing an information bring forth the same charges. Attorney Saperstein waives the formal reading of the  information and stands mute on behalf of his client. Court advises the clerk to enter NG pleas. Attorney Saperstein request a plea and sentencing date.

Court Orders:
$10,000 signature bond
Not to possess any firearms or have any firearms in the home.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Attorney Saperstein waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing. Court waives the preliminary hearing.

Next Appearance set for May 11 at 4 PM
